Detailed Description

Allows accessing the display configuration. This configuration file is mandatory for APOXI. The header file may not be changed or extended in any manner, it is only allowed to customize the implementation of the methods. If additional methods are needed for the MMI it is required to create a custom configuration file.

Member Function Documentation

static INT DisplayConfig::GetBitsPerPixel (  INT  display_idx  )  [static]
 

Returns the number of bits per pixel that are used for the color information.

static const ColorSegmentation& DisplayConfig::GetColorSegmentation (  INT  display_idx  )  [static]
 

Returns the color segmentation of the display with the index display_idx.

static const ColorTable& DisplayConfig::GetColorTable (  INT  display_idx  )  [static]
 

Returns the ColorTable of display with the index display_idx. If Display::PlanesMode returns FALSE an empty color table may returned as the colors are part of the pixel itself.

static INT DisplayConfig::GetDisplayCount (   )  [static]
 

Returns the number of displays. If two displays are used then 0 usually represents the main display and 1 the sub display.

static UINT8 GDI_HUGE* DisplayConfig::GetFrameBuffer (  INT  display_idx  )  [static]
 

Returns a pointer to the frame buffer. The frame buffer is used by APOXI for doing the drawing operations.

Parameters:
display_idx Index of the display. Usually 0 represents the main display and 1 the sub display.

static XYDIM DisplayConfig::GetHeight (  INT  display_idx  )  [static]
 

Returns the height of display with the index display_idx.

static UINT8 GDI_HUGE* DisplayConfig::GetMaskBuffer (  INT  display_idx  )  [static]
 

Returns a pointer to the mask buffer which is used to mix the video layer with the frame buffer of the display device. Return 0, is no mixing is required.

Parameters:
display_idx Index of the display. Usually 0 represents the main display and 1 the sub display.

static UINT8 GDI_HUGE* DisplayConfig::GetTransferBuffer (  INT  display_idx  )  [static]
 

Returns a pointer to the transfer buffer which contains a copy of the frame buffer to allow an asynchronous DMA by a low level display driver. 0 may be returned if no transfer buffer should be used, but this may slow down the drawing process. The transfer buffer must have the same size as the frame buffer.

Parameters:
display_idx Index of the display. Usually 0 represents the main display and 1 the sub display.

static XYDIM DisplayConfig::GetWidth (  INT  display_idx  )  [static]
 

Returns the width of display with the index display_idx.

static BOOLEAN DisplayConfig::PlanesMode (  INT  display_idx  )  [static]
 

Returns TRUE, if display with the index display_idx is organized in the plane format. FALSE is returned, if the display is organized in bits-per-pixel format.
